communications.subject: FOIA 202500040F Acknowledgment
communications.communication:
Dear Sai:

This email acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Export-Import Bank of the United States (EXIM), which we received in our FOIA office via email on October 22, 2024. We have designated your inquiry as FOIA Request # 202500040F. Please include this request number on all correspondence with the FOIA office.

You requested the following information in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format:


  1.  The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.


  1.  The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.


  1.  The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.


  1.  The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

We respond to request on a first-in, first-out basis and on a multi-track system. Your request has been placed on the complex track. You may wish to narrow the scope of your request to identify specific documents in order to be eligible for the faster track. To do so, please send a written request, identifying the specific documents sought, to Export-Import Bank of the United States, 811 Vermont Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C., 20571, ATTN: FOIA OFFICER.  You may also submit a narrowed request via E-Mail at foia@exim.gov<mailto:foia@exim.gov>. The phrase "Narrowed Request" should appear on the letter and on the outside of the envelope containing the narrowed request or in the "Subject" line of the E-Mail. Please include the request number listed above on all correspondence with the FOIA office. We will notify you if your request is placed in the simple track.

EXIM intends to disclose the requested records to the fullest extent of the law. Please be assured that we are processing your request as expeditiously as possible. However, the records you seek require a search in another Office, and so your request falls within "unusual circumstances." See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B)(i)-(iii). Because of these unusual circumstances, we need to extend the time limit to respond to your request beyond the ten additional days provided by the statute. We have not yet completed a search to determine whether there are records within the scope of your request. The time needed to process your request will necessarily depend on the complexity of our records search and the volume and complexity of any records located. In an effort to speed up your records search, you may wish to narrow the scope of your request to limit the number of potentially responsive records or agree to an alternative timeframe for processing, should records be located; or you may wish to await the completion of our records search to discuss either of these options.

Please note that we are considering your request for a fee waiver and will provide a response once a determination has been made.
If you have any questions or wish to discuss reformulation or an alternative time frame for the processing of your request, you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison, Ms. Lennell Jackson at (202) 565-3290.  Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001; e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.

If you have any questions about this request, please feel free to contact me. Thanks.


Sincerely,



Lennell Jackson | FOIA Public Liaison
Export-Import Bank of the United States
811 Vermont Ave. NW | Washington, DC 20571
202-565-3290 | lennell.jackson@exim.gov

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Clinton County Excited Delirium Training Materials
communications.communication:
Greetings,

                You have asked for “Any and all training materials used in the past four years (January 1, 2020 through January 1, 2024) that mention excited delirium / agitated delirium / bell's mania / lethal catatonia.”

We are reviewing all of our training materials to ensure there is no mention, or those items would need to be turned over. This takes a lot of time as any agency, whether 5 people or 1,000 people would need the same materials to teach and time to review such to ensure they are answering the FOIL accurately. We are a small agency and therefore the staffing to answer this on top of our regular jobs makes it slower than some.



I do hope you understand.

Major Nicholas J Leon
Chief Deputy
Clinton County Sheriff's Office

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (U.S. Census Bureau)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (U.S. Census Bureau)
communications.communication:
Dear U.S. Census Bureau,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to U.S. Census Bureau's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Oct. 23, 2024. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #DOC-CEN-2025-000025.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Re: Freedom of Information Act Request #DOC-CEN-2025-000025
communications.communication:
Census - General

Good morning, Sai,

The responsive records requested by you and assigned to DOC-CEN-2025-000025 were forwarded to you on November 21, 2024, and expired on December 21, 2024.
The records and a letter addressed to you were sent using Kiteworks which is a secure encrypted messaging system used by the Census Bureau to send messages safely.

We will send your responsive records and letter again this morning using the same Kiteworks system.

You will receive an email message at the email address supplied by you when you made your FOIA request. When you access that email message, you'll see a clickable "button" that says "Access message here", or something very close to that.

Click on that button.

The system will instruct you to enter your email address. After you enter your email address you will be asked for a password. This is a password that you will create as this will be your Kiteworks account.  Once you enter your password you will be able to access your letter and responsive records.

Remember these documents are only accessible for 30 days after which they expire. Please look for this message today and access the documents timely.

Very respectfully,

The Census Bureau FOIA Team



Census - General

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: John McCain
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All files concerning John McCain, late Senator from Arizona whose death is mentioned here:

https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/sen-john-mccain-independent-voice-gop-establishment-dies-81-n790971

I am requesting the search include all record systems including the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) indices, the Microphone (MISUR) indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) indices, for both main-file and cross-reference records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ryan Weisensee

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: John McCain
communications.communication:
Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 134 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 523 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,335 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,875 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Radio and Technical Equipment Purchased by the Soviets

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Radio and Technical Equipment Purchased by the Soviets
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Files captioned "Radio or Technical Equipment Purchased by the Soviets", including 105-HQ-30365. This program was described in a 1975 memo as  "Recording of Soviet purchases in such areas -- intelligence and counterintelligence purposes." (https://www.archives.gov/files/research/jfk/releases/2018/docid-32989624.pdf)

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1497857-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 152 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 922 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,964 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: John McCain
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to or mentioning John Sidney McCain III (August 29, 1936 – August 25, 2018).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: John McCain (FBI)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Absolutely any and all files and materials regarding or referencing John McCain, whose death on August 25, 2018 was widely reported by the mainstream media. [For reference: https://www.cnn.com/2018/08/25/politics/john-mccain-obituary/index.html]

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc.

Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency.

Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Beryl Lipton

Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 134 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 523 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,335 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,875 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

title: Full Text of "Here to Stay Committee" Emails

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Full Text of "Here to Stay Committee" Emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all emails that contain the following text in their subject lines:

“Mary Ellen Tamasy Conversation // IHDA Financing for "Here to Stay" Program”
“Here to Stay Initiative”
“Here to Stay Committee”
"Hear to Stay Committee"
"Next Steps for the Here to Stay Committee"
“Here to stay committee (second draft)”
“Discussion on Here to Stay Committee [City Council Agenda Items]”
“Hear (Here?) to Stay Committee”
“Here to Stay Committee meeting on 2/1”
“Evanston Here to Stay Committee”
“Here to Stay 4/18”
“Here to Stay (For Review Tonight)”

These emails were identified through metadata from a previous FOIA request (#24-3020). Please provide the full text of these emails, along with all associated metadata, headers, and attachments, regardless of the sender or recipient role (To, CC, or BCC).

Also:
In January of 2022 there was an email with the subject line: “Presentation shared with you: "Here to Stay"”
Please include the presentation file from that google link.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Niles Coalition

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request #24-3592
communications.communication:
Hello, on Nov. 26, 2024 we spoke with a person in the clerk's office after we received the communication about this being  unduly burdensome the first time. They suggested narrowing down the request by date. We asked to run a search for the year 2022 to see if that was acceptable. We later got a phone call that day saying it was. We updated our request to reflect that agreement. 

Furthermore how did narrowing a request to the year 2022 turn up more pages (1,200) that the original un-narrowed request (1,137)?

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request #24-3592
communications.communication:
Hello,

Our request was narrowed several times to accommodate Evanston's measure of what is deemed to be "unduly burdensome ". Evanston finally accepted the narrowed request to provide emails ONLY  sent by councilmember Bobby Burns with the following subject lines:

“Mary Ellen Tamasy Conversation // IHDA Financing for "Here to Stay" Program”
“Here to Stay Initiative”
“Here to Stay Committee”
"Hear to Stay Committee"
"Next Steps for the Here to Stay Committee"
“Here to stay committee (second draft)”
“Discussion on Here to Stay Committee [City Council Agenda Items]”
“Hear (Here?) to Stay Committee”
“Here to Stay Committee meeting on 2/1”
“Evanston Here to Stay Committee”
“Here to Stay 4/18”
“Here to Stay (For Review Tonight)”

These are known subject lines obtained by a previous request for email metadata.

Also, there was a presentation file we were requesting called “Presentation shared with you: "Here to Stay"” that was obtained through the same metadata request (#24-3020).

The pdf provided (24-3592.pdf) as a responsive record to this request had NONE of these qualifiers. We only found one email with the subject line "Discussion on Here to Stay Committee [City Council Agenda Items]" and none of those were even sent by Bobby Burns.

These records are not what we asked for and no denial was given.

We spoke with Raymond in the Clerk's office and he gave me the email for paralegal Kina Robinson who was apparently the responsible party for this record release. We are sending her an email in addition to this request update communication.

title: Emails between DeSantis Office and John Wilson

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Emails between DeSantis Office and John Wilson
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

- all communications between Sep. 1 and Oct. 11, 2024, to and from former Florida Department of Health general counsel John Wilson and the following Executive Office staff: Sam Elliot, Assistant General Counsel; Ryan Newman, General Counsel; and/or Jed Doty, Deputy General Counsel.

For the purposes of this request, this includes but is not limited to private email addresses used for government business, text messages, and any other medium subject to the Sunshine Law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: UMass Amherst Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
Hello,

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I am hereby submitting a Public Records Request for all money given from University of Massachusetts (Amherst) to external vendors/suppliers in FY2015 through (and including) FY2024, a total of 10 years.

Specifically, the data I am requesting include (but are not limited to):
* all vendors, suppliers, individuals, and public-private partnerships
* all materials, goods, services, properties, commodities, equipment leases, property leases, and licenses
* all catalog orders, non-catalog orders, blanket orders, direct payments, bank card purchases, strategic sourcing, and competitive procurements
* all auxiliary services purchases (starts in 2022, may be from a different accounting system)
* all purchase orders, requisitions, and invoices
* all products, goods, services, contracts, and subcontracts
* all accounts, classes, commodities, and departments
* regardless of the funding source

I’m requesting the data in a single Excel spreadsheet file (.xlsx format) with at least the following columns:
* Amount
* Supplier/Vendor Name
* Account Description
* Commodity Description
* Fiscal Year
* Department/Origin Description

Please report every expense, even if one or more of the above fields is blank. Please also include negative expense amounts, which is rare but does occur.

In case it’s helpful, I've attached an image example of what I’m hoping to receive. The columns may be in any order, and the fiscal years may be on one sheet or different sheets. The columns can be sorted in any order, or unsorted if that’s easiest.

I’m anticipating that this request may be fulfilled by a simple financial report generation and export of the generated file, and therefore shouldn’t take much human time or incur any fees. Please let me know immediately if this isn’t the case, so I can modify my request as necessary to meet the PRL deadline of 10 business days.

Please email the Excel file by the deadline of Monday August 26th, 2024.

Thank you very much!

Sincerely,

AJ Vincelli
Graduate Student Union at UMass Dartmouth

communications.subject: FW: FW: UMass Amherst Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24 Public Records Request Submitted Online   [case: 00302536
communications.communication:
AJ,
I am in receipt of your records request as detailed below.

The Massachusetts Public Records Law, M.G.L. Ch. 66, § 10, along with its associated regulations, permits the University to estimate and assess the estimated cost of searching for the requested records or segregating exempt information from non-exempt information.  I estimate that your request took less than four hours to complete and there will be no copying fee charged for this request.  As a, result there will be no fee.

Please find below the Dropbox link for the data requested. Considering the size of the data, it was not possible to email the files.

https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/28xkdc25ph5que7m4u2mj/AFdzxLiRKQtv-6fNqYtxYVA?rlkey=v3i9nkcfxmv31jn38fisr4zts&e=1&st=nhiwzmm8&dl=0
Under Chapter 66 of the General Laws, you have the right to appeal our disposition of your request to the Supervisor of Public Records, Office of the Secretary of State, pre@sec.state.ma.us<mailto:pre@sec.state.ma.us>  and the right to seek judicial review of an unfavorable decision by commencing a civil action in the superior court under subsection (c) of section 10A.

Thank you,
Christine

=================================
Christine M. Wilda
Associate Chancellor for Compliance
UMASS Amherst
340 Whitmore Building
Amherst, MA  01003
Ph:     413-545-2148
Fax:    413-545-2114
cwilda@umass.edu<mailto:cwilda@umass.edu>

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: UMass Amherst Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
Hi Christine,

I apologize for my delay in replying, and thank you for this info.

The spreadsheets look like they're missing the Department Description, Account Description, and Commodity Description columns. Can these 3 columns please be added?

Also, there are 2 columns both labeled "Date." Can you clarify the column titles? I see there is another date column for Created, so perhaps the other 2 are the date requested and the date paid?

Finally, in the Procard spreadsheets, the vendors aren't listed. Can the Vendor column please be added?

In case it’s helpful, here's an image example of what I’m hoping to receive: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1X6F243FNwo9OaomEK2Y7n_1faa9cfHHW/view?usp=sharing

Thanks very much,

AJ Vincelli

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: UMass Amherst Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
Hi Christine,

Please respond.

Sincerely,

AJ Vincelli

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: UMass Amherst Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
AJ,

Thank you for your patience as we worked on the updated data request. To ensure accuracy, we had to create new queries to extract the data and map the account, department, and commodity descriptions from another source, which caused the delay.
You can access the updated data through the following link: Updated Data Link<https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/8jp77u5pua8of7cxei2hc/APLLmqest8zeUZQcCw0RnMI?rlkey=1xumabajqyqmzh02mbwbllktw&st=s7xs3dx7&dl=0>

Key Points About the Data:

  1.  As requested, I've included all three fields in the dataset and removed redundant dates.
  2.  Commodity codes are only available for spend data from 2019 onward; all data prior to 2019 will have "N/A" for commodity codes. Additionally, departmental payments do not have mapped commodity codes.
  3.  There are two date fields in the Pro Card data:
     *   Transaction Date Actual (G.L.): The date the journal was posted to the General Ledger.
     *   Pro Card Transaction Date: The actual transaction date of the Pro Card transaction.
Thank you,
Christine


=================================
Christine M. Wilda

340F Whitmore Building
181 President's Drive
Amherst, MA  01003

cwilda@umass.edu<mailto:cwilda@umass.edu>

communications.subject: Re: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Massasoit CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
Sent on behalf of Alex J. Villanueva, RAO, Massasoit Community College

Dear AJ Vincelli,

I am writing to confirm receipt of your request and to initiate a response within ten (10) business days.

It is the College’s intent to supply you with a fee estimate for this request. But before we provide the formal fee estimate, we wanted to inform you of the scope and scale of the work the College must conduct to produce these materials.

The College does not have an existing report that includes all of the information you are requesting. The College’s Comptroller would therefore need to manually compile disparate reports to produce this information, all while reviewing the information closely to make any redactions needed. This time-intensive process would require at least four to six weeks (and at least 150 hours). At the $25/hour rate set by the Commonwealth’s Public Records Law, we would anticipate a fee estimate of at least $3,750.

Per your request, we invite you to modify your request as necessary. But please understand that there will likely still be a significant amount of “human time” to review for redactions and may still necessitate a (albeit reduced) fee.

Upon your response to this email or a revision of the request, we will issue the formal fee estimate for your review.

Thank you,

Alex J. Villanueva
Records Access Officer


Karina I. Sallaway

Communications Specialist | Office of College Communications

[cid:1111e5e2-7f04-4ffa-b535-5f0362c42594]

One Massasoit Boulevard | Brockton, MA 02302

508-588-9100 x1085 | www.massasoit.edu<http://www.massasoit.edu/> | @massasoitCC

communications.communication:
Hi Alex and Karina,

Oh dear, this sounds like a lot of work. Also, I apologize for my delay in responding.

I was hoping that a spreadsheet with the info I requested would be relatively simple. For example, these other community colleges were able to fulfill my request:

MassBay CC:
https://www.muckrock.com/foi/framingham-105/massbay-cc-vendor-expenses-fy15-fy24-171633/

Cape Cod CC:
https://www.muckrock.com/foi/massachusetts-1/cape-cod-cc-vendor-expenses-fy15-fy24-171645/

Is Massasoit CC's system truly that burdensome? If so, which portions of my request are causing the most trouble?

Thanks,

AJ Vincelli

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (October 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Sheriff Public Records Request :: S020910-103024
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Spokane County. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. Your request was received in this office on 10/30/2024 and given the reference number S020910-103024 for tracking purposes. Spokane County Sheriff provides access to public records in compliance with applicable laws and statutes of the State of Washington. In accordance with the public records law, the Sheriff's office has five business days to respond to a request for public records. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fspokane-county-sheriffs-office-561%252Fpolice-staff-roster-october-2024-175584%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAwLMyQ_gKHxZfHlysTK9ujJ1s%3A1t6KhW%3A3RjvyO12FexkQZY5_qmIMeYSqWSiVuDAXYuRRfQCxdI 
Not all public documents are available in electronic format. If the document(s) requested are not available electronically, we will make them available for inspection or by paper copy in accordance with the Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
Please be advised that Spokane Regional Emergency Communications ("SREC") is the custodian of 911 and Crime Check audio recordings as well as audio recordings of dispatch and radio traffic. If you are attempting to obtain audio recordings of 911/Crime Check calls and/or radio traffic, you need to submit a separate request to SREC directly. You can submit a records request to SREC via their website, https://www.srec911.com. 
Spokane County

Our procedure is to locate records, review them for exemptions, and then prepare them for your inspection or copying. Due to the potential volume of records that may be responsive to this request, as well as the complexity of identifying and gathering the records, we anticipate processing this request in installments. We are currently processing over 880 active requests. This does mean that it can take time to process requests, but we work to provide requestors with installments of their records on a timely basis. 
We reasonably anticipate an installment/requested records will be available on or before 12/20/2024. If public records become available in advance of this estimate, we will let you know. Conversely, if staff encounters a need to extend our estimate, we will advise accordingly. 
With respect to audio recordings, please be advised that Spokane Regional Emergency Communications ("SREC") is the custodian of 911/Crime Check audio recordings as well as audio recordings of radio traffic. If you are attempting to obtain audio recordings of 911/Crime Check calls and/or radio traffic, you need to submit a separate request to SREC directly via the following link: https://srec911.com/ 
Finally, please be advised that there may be fees associated with the copying of public records. Please take a moment to  familiarize yourself with Spokane County's Public Records Request Policy and Fee Schedule, which can be found in the FAQs section. 
Sincerely, 
JOHN F. NOWELS, Sheriff 
Spokane County 
LB 
Public Records Specialist 
Please do not update subject line above when replying.

communications.subject: [Records Center] Sheriff Public Records Request :: S020910-103024
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Rose Terse: 
This message is to provide an update regarding your public records request assigned reference code S020910-103024. Please include this code in any communications concerning this request. 
Specifically, you requested: “To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fspokane-county-sheriffs-office-561%252Fpolice-staff-roster-october-2024-175584%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAwLMyQ_gKHxZfHlysTK9ujJ1s%3A1t6KhW%3A3RjvyO12FexkQZY5_qmIMeYSqWSiVuDAXYuRRfQCxdI” 
The responsive records are now available for download in the “My Request Center” of the public records portal. Instructions for downloading the files follows:  
  * Navigate to the Spokane County Public Records Center by following the blue "Public Records Center" hyperlink contained in the footer of this email. 
  * Log in with your user name and password. You will be taken directly into this request. 
  * Click on the "Download All" button directly above the blue "Files" box. *If you have a pop-up blocker, you will need to allow pop-ups for this site in order for the files to download. After they have downloaded, if the files do not open automatically, they will appear in your computer's "Downloads" folder. 
The Spokane County Sheriff's Office is obligated to provide records in accordance with the Washington State Public Records Act. Please note that the records you have requested may contain images and/or descriptions of events that are considered graphic in nature and may not be suitable for children or those who are sensitive to such material. 
This request is now considered concluded and closed because all responsive records have been provided. This is our final, definitive response to this request. Now that this request is closed, the Public Records Act's one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has started to run because the agency does not intend to further address this request. If you have questions or concerns about this request, please contact us within 10 business days of the date of this message. If we may be of further assistance, please advise. PLEASE NOTE: If you want to pick up printed copies of the records from the Public Safety Building, you must call 509-477-6926 at least one business day before you plan to arrive so that we can have the records ready for you. Depending on the number of pages, printing charges may apply. 
Sincerely, 
JOHN F. NOWELS, Sheriff 
Spokane County 
LB 
Public Records Specialist 
Please do not update subject line above when replying.

title: NY sheriff data collection request (2016-2021) (Rensselaer County Sheriff)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NY sheriff data collection request (2016-2021) (Rensselaer County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1.the total number of use of force incidents, separated by year, from 2016-2021 (for example, information that specifies the total number of use of force incidents in 2016, total number of use of force incidents in 2017, etc.). Please include as part of this a breakdown of how many use of force incidents in each year were related to law enforcement operations and how many were related to correctional/custodial operations.
2. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by year and type of force used from 2016-2021 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2016, baton incidents in 2016, etc.). Please include as part of this a breakdown of how many use of force incidents in each year were related to law enforcement operations and how many were related to correctional/custodial operations.
3. the total number of civilian complaints alleging any form of law enforcement misconduct that were reported and the total number sustained, separated by year from 2016-2021 (for example, 8 complaints in 2020, 2 complaints sustained in 2020, 4 complaints in 2021, 1 complaint sustained in 2021, etc.)
4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained from 2016-2021, separated by year
5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained from 2016-2021, separated by year
6. the total number of officer involved shootings incidents from 2016-2021, separated by year (excluding shootings of animals and accidental discharges that are not directed at a person)

When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.

Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints alleging police misconduct, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: FOIL 2024-122
communications.communication:
Concerning your recent FOIL request, please see attached.

Also, in the future, kindly place your FOIL requests by visiting our website at www.rensco.com<http://www.rensco.com> and follow the instructions on filing a FOIL.  We ask that your requests be placed directly with the Rensselaer County Attorney and not through the Sheriff's Department.

This would save a lot of time and also would ensure that your requests have been received.  We have several faxes requesting statuses on previous requests which we have no record of receiving your original requests.  I have opened three new FOIL requests based upon the information we recently received.

Thank you and please feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Deborah A. Brooking
Records Access Officer

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Sheriff Data Collection Request (2021)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year used in 2021 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2021, baton incidents in 2021, etc.). Please include as part of this a breakdown of how many use of force incidents in each year were related to law enforcement operations and how many were related to correctional/custodial operations.
 
2. the total number of civilian complaints alleging any form of law enforcement misconduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.
 
3. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.
 
4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.
 
5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.
 
6. the total number of officer involved shootings in 2021, both fatal and non-fatal.
 
When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.
 
Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints alleging police misconduct, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.communication:
Concerning your recent FOIL request, please see attached.

Also, in the future, kindly place your FOIL requests by visiting our website at www.rensco.com<http://www.rensco.com> and follow the instructions on filing a FOIL.  We ask that your requests be placed directly with the Rensselaer County Attorney and not through the Sheriff's Department.

This would save a lot of time and also would ensure that your requests have been received.  We have several faxes requesting statuses on previous requests which we have no record of receiving your original requests.  I have opened three new FOIL requests based upon the information we recently received.

Thank you and please feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Deborah A. Brooking

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CCH Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show all reports sent to the Chicago Coalition for the Homeless:

1. CCH receives a monthly report from CPS (example attached), include original and corrected reports;
2. Any other reports that CCH receives related to students in transitional living situations. 

Please send all reports from January 1, 2024 to current.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Attachments:

https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/miriamcb/148697/STLS_CCH_Report_12.31.23_Corrected.xlsx
Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fcch-reports-177218%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1tJO03%3A9_v0Hy2exz-ALg7vUnZETOHb61VpJZOnGQwiE2EGGd4 
 
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Agency Roster (Berkeley Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Public Record Request Submitted for Public Record Request - Marcus Boyd
communications.communication:
Hello Marcus Boyd,

Public Record Request Title


Public Record Request - Marcus Boyd  


Public Record Request #


NPR2024-0070978 


Name of Requestor


Marcus Boyd 


Status


Submitted 


Request Submitted Date


12/18/2024 5:00 PM 






Your Public Record Service Request has been successfully submitted. You will be notified by email if more information or payment is required and when your request is completed. The Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department - Public Records Unit hours of operation are 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday, excluding holidays, Juneteenth, Nevada Day, the day after Thanksgiving and December 24th.  Any public record requests made outside of normal business hours will be deemed received the next business day. At any time, you may monitor the status of your request by logging into your Public Records portal account.

***Please note that holidays that fall on a Saturday or Sunday will be observed the preceding Friday or the following Monday. There are 13 holidays that LVMPD observes throughout the year. Based on this information, adjust your request accordingly.

Public Request Portal | Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department (lvmpd.com)<https://www.lvmpd.com/i-want-to/file/public-request-portal>

Thank you,

Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department
400 S. Martin L. King Boulevard
Las Vegas, Nevada  89106
702-828-7489
Monday-Friday 8am to 5pm

communications.subject: Ref: NPR2024-0070978
communications.communication:
December 19, 2024

Marcus Boyd
177727-55703168@requests.muckrock.com

Re: Nevada Public Records Request NPR2024-0070978

Dear Marcus Boyd,

This correspondence is in response to your Nevada Public Records Act NPR2024-0070978.

You requested:
1. Complaint form
2. Policies/Procedures regarding complaints

In reference to number one (1) of your request, you can locate our employee complaint form online. We have included the link below:

  *   https://www.lvmpd.com/about/transparency/internal-affairs

In reference to number two (2) of your request please see attached as well as below.

  The Public Records Unit forwarded your request to our Policy and Research Group and they determined the request, as worded is too broad. As currently requested, they are unable to confirm what documents are responsive.

Please note, you are seeking any/all records but have not sought a particular record about a particular event, and your request is otherwise overbroad and/or vague. As such, your request is not a request for a sufficiently identifiable record. The Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department (LVMPD) is unable to conduct a simple “Google”-like search of its databases. We must ask that you narrow your request to a specific policy.

The Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department (LVMPD) does not readily maintain any particular record containing the information you are seeking. Moreover, LVMPD databases cannot “readily compile the requested information.” See Public Employees Retirement System of Nevada v. Nevada Policy Research Inst., Inc., --- Nev. ---, 429 P.3d 280, 288 (2018), quoting Las Vegas Metro. Police Dep’t v. Blackjack Bonding, Inc., 131 Nev. 80, 87, 343 P.3d 608, 613 (2015). In other words, your request requires LVMPD to do more than simply “[s]earch[] an electronic database to produce existing records and data….” Public Employees Retirement System at 287, quoting ACLU of Arizona v. Arizona Dep’t of Child Safety, 377 P.3d 339, 346 (Ariz. Ct. App. 2016). Rather, your request requires LVMPD to “compile information about the information [the database] contains.” Id. (emphasis added). As such, your request requires the creation of a new record, which LVMPD has no duty to do under the Nevada Public Records Act. Public Employees Retirement System at 286.

In order to inspect or copy a public record, the specific record must be identified by the person requesting the record. Courts in addressing this issue have held that “agencies are required to disclose only ‘identifiable’ governmental records not otherwise exempt.” Hodai v. City of Tucson & Tucson Police Dep’t, 2014 Ariz. Super. LEXIS 2158, *18 (Ariz. Super. Ct. 2014), quoting MAG Entertainment, LLC v. Division of Alcohol Beverages Control, 868 A.2d 1067, 1076 (N.J. Sup. Ct., App. Div. 2005). “Wholesale requests for general information to be analyzed, collated and compiled by the responding government entity are not encompassed therein.” Id. A governmental agency is not required to respond to an overbroad request that does not request specific records. MAG Entertainment at 1074, citing Capitol Information Association v. Ann Arbor Police, 360 N.W.2d 262, 263 (1985); cf. NAC 239.863(1)(c) (public records request must include a description of the public record that is sufficient to identify the record).

If you obtain any additional information that may assist in our recovery of records you seek, a new request may be submitted. As a courtesy we are providing following policies, that may be responsive to your request.  2.225 Internal Affairs Bureau, 8.330 Maintenance of Values and Ethics & 8.355 Purging of disciplinary files (please see attachments).

Respectfully,

Public Records Unit
Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department
400-A South Martin L. King Boulevard, Las Vegas, Nevada 89106

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

title: Policies and communications re: art installation

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Policies and communications re: art installation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications between Brian Noland and any elected official between November 10 and December 9, 2024.

2. Any communications sent to or by the Office of Government Relations (including any of its staff members) and sent to or by any elected official concerning the FL3TCHER Exhibit. This request is limited to communications between November 10 and December 9, 2024.

3. Any contract, agreement, or policies concerning the persons or entities responsible for the FL3TCHER Exhibit. (This request should not be construed as seeking a search of records held by the persons or entities responsible for the FL3TCHER Exhibit, but instead limited to records held by the university administration.)

4. Any policies concerning  the use of (or the availability of) the Reece Museum space for art installations, exhibits, or events. This request is limited to policies in place or used since January 1, 2024.

5. Any contracts between the Reece Museum and any curator or artist since January 1, 2022.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Adam Steinbaugh.

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Gardner PD Modified DESE Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M. G. L.c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your police department.

Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE has expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection.

A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”

A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”

I request the following public records, as defined in M. G. L.c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):

1. An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced). I request an extract of the database to be provided as an electronic spreadsheet (.xls, .xlsx, .csv, .tsv, or .ods format). If such format is unavailable, we request the extract of the database to be provided in a searchable, machine-readable form, as per 950 CMR 32.04(5).” Specifically, we request an extract of the database to include the following descriptions of the data in each column. This may be provided as clear, descriptive column headers in the database extract or in a separate document:

a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement

b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement

c. Charge (or charges)

d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement

e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement

f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement

g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement

h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement

i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement

j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school.

k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and

l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable.

m. Incident number or other unique identifier for each arrest or referral to law enforcement

n. Offender number or other unique identifier for each individual arrested or referred to law enforcement

2. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each school-related arrest conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).

3. Please provide an unduplicated count of arrested students for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).

4. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until

the day the records are produced), per the U.S. Department of Education’s Civil Rights Data Collection for that year. For each referral to law enforcement, please include the school, demographic, and incident information described in DESE’s School Safety and Discipline Report Data Handbook v. 20.0.

5. Please also provide an unduplicated counts of referrals to law enforcement (as defined above) for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022 and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to determine whether your school district and police department are complying with their reporting obligations under the Criminal Justice Reform Act. “The public has an interest in knowing whether public servants are carrying out their duties in an efficient and law-abiding manner.”

It would be ill-advised to impose a fee for data that your police department may have failed to report in violation of statutory and regulatory duty. Moreover, as you know, municipalities with a population of over 20,000 may not assess a fee for the first 2 hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs.

Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M. G. L.c 66, § 6A(d).

The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply. To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety.

If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.

Sincerely,

Katherine Stathulis

J.D. Research Fellow

Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration k.stathulis@northeastern.edu

617-373-5862

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rylee Meints

communications.subject: Public Information :: P015143-121024
communications.communication:
Dear Marcus Boyd: 
Your request has been received and is being processed within state law. Your request was received in this office and given the reference number P015143-121024 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to all sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd
