communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Job Postings
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records showing all organizations and/or publications, websites, etc. VM posted jobs to for the period August 2023 to the date of this request such as, without limitation, HigherEdJobs, Chronical of Higher Education, etc.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Seattle Police Foundation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All contracts, grants, memorandums of agreement (MOAs), memorandums of understanding (MOUs), and non-disclosure agreements (NDAs) between the Seattle Police Department and the Seattle Police Foundation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: P167785-011824
communications.communication:
This email is in further response to your public disclosure records request P167785-011824. The Seattle Police Department has records ready to be released pending payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 SPD strongly encourages online payments. 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: P167785-011824. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-P167785-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. After we receive your payment through the Police Records Request Center Secure Payments, the Public Disclosure Unit will release your records within one to two business days and send you a notice with instructions on how to download the records. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net)

SPD receives over 13,000 public records requests annually and is processing between 2,500 to 3,000 open requests at any given time. This may result in a slower than anticipated response to your request. Thank you for your 
patience. 
 
As a reminder you can login at the Police Records Request Center where you can access Police online information, manage your profile, submit record requests, track your request status, receive and send messages, make payments, view frequently asked questions, and download your records. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Amherst PD Grant Applications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Amherst Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Amherst PD Grant Applications
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Gelardi:



This will acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by the Division of Criminal Justice Services on March 22, 2024. The request was for "All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Amherst Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present."



Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law.



A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached in approximately 20 business days or we will notify you in writing if the responsible program area(s) should require additional time to locate, assemble and review documents that may be responsive to your request.



Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs.  When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made.







Very truly yours,


Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Agency Roster (Vallejo Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Body Camera Footage
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide body camera footage from all arresting officers: 

Incident Involving Sean M. Shaw (May 5, 2016)
Details: Traffic stop in Voorhees, NJ, for an expired registration. Interaction escalated into a physical altercation where Sean M. Shaw allegedly resisted arrest and assaulted officers.
Charges: Obstruction, two counts of aggravated assault on a police officer, resisting arrest, and criminal mischief.

Incident Involving Arthur Barclay (June 7, 2018)
Details: Former State Assemblyman Arthur Barclay was involved in a domestic dispute in Camden’s Fairview section and was charged with simple assault.

Fatal Accident Following Attempted Motor Vehicle Stop (February 6, 2021)
Details: Officers attempted to stop Rashad M. Muse, who fled the scene and was fatally struck by civilian vehicles after exiting his vehicle and running onto I-676.

Incident Involving Weapon Discharge by Officer (April 24, 2023)
Details: A man allegedly assaulted a police officer during an incident where the officer’s weapon discharged, striking the suspect. Incident occurred in Camden County.

Camden Public Protest Incident (August 28, 2020)
Details: An incident during a public protest in Camden where multiple individuals were charged with resisting arrest following a confrontation with law enforcement.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Body Cam Review

communications.subject: Welcome to the Camden County Open Public Records Center

Thank you for registering with the Camden County Open Public Records Center.  Please log in to the Records Center to update any contact or password information and to track the progress of your request. 
 Login: 177306-70456900@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password, you may request a temporary password here: 
 
Request Temporary Password here. (https://camdencountynj.mycusthelp.com/webapp/_rs/ForgotPassword.aspx)

communications.subject: Open Public Records Act Request :: W030903-120824
communications.communication:
Steffani Lon  
 
 Custodian of Records  Telephone: (856) 225 – 2131 
 Camden County Administration   
 520 Market Street, 8th Floor 
 Camden, NJ 08102-1375 
Dear Body Review: 
 
Thank you for submitting an Open Public Records request with Camden County. Your request was given the reference number W030903-120824 for tracking purposes. 
 
 
Our office will forward your request to the appropriate Department for their review and search of their files for the requested records. A written response will be sent to you within seven business days or sooner depending on the type of records requested. 
 
 
Please note that day one of the calculation begins the day after the custodian receives your OPRA request. This calculation applies to the agency’s actual business days of operations which are 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. If the agency is closed for a Holiday, this date does not count towards the seven business day deadline. Any request received after the close of business will be deemed received on the next business day. 
 
You may monitor the progress of your request at the link below. Additionally, you will receive an email from our office to inform you when your request has been completed and a response is posted at the below link. 
 
Again, thank you for using the Open Public Records Center. 
 
 
Open Public Records Center - http://www.camdencounty.com/open-public-records-opra/ 
Steffani Lon 
Custodian of Records

communications.subject: RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request #W030903-120824

Thanks - BCR

communications.subject: Open Records Request :: W030903-120824
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

   
 Steffani Lon  
 Custodian of Records  Telephone: (856) 225 – 2131 
 Camden County Administration   
 520 Market Street, 8th Floor 
 Camden, NJ 08102-1375 
 
Please DO NOT REPLY to this email. This mailbox is not monitored and you will not receive a response. FOR FURTHER CORRESPONDENCE PLEASE send an email to opra.custodian@camdencounty.com or GENERATE A NEW REQUEST THROUGH THE OPEN RECORDS CENTER. (mailto:opracustodian@camdencounty.com) 
12/18/2024 
Body Review 

MuckRock News, DEPT MR177306 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston, MA 02115 
RE: OPRA Request of 12/8/2024, Reference # W030903-120824 
Dear Body Review, 
The Camden County Custodian of Records received your Open Public Records Act request on 12/8/2024.  To access your request please click here. Your request for: "Incident Involving Sean M. Shaw (May 5, 2016) 
Details: Traffic stop in Voorhees, NJ, for an expired registration. Interaction escalated into a physical altercation where Sean M. Shaw allegedly resisted arrest and assaulted officers. 
Charges: Obstruction, two counts of aggravated assault on a police officer, resisting arrest, and criminal mischief." 
Custodian's Response: The types of documents that you are requesting are not created and/or maintained by any of Camden County's Departments. Please contact the Voorhees Township Police Department to request records. Your request for: "Incident Involving Arthur Barclay (June 7, 2018) 
Details: Former State Assemblyman Arthur Barclay was involved in a domestic dispute in Camden’s Fairview section and was charged with simple assault." 
Custodian's Response: The Camden County Police Department conducted a search of their files and provided records containing redactions pursuant to Drivers’ license numbers - N.J.S.A. 47:1A-1.1, et seq.; Police incident reports - Considered criminal investigatory records exempt from disclosure under OPRA; N.J.S.A. 47:1A-1.1; N.J.S.A. 47:1A-6; Feggans v. City of Newark (Essex), GRC Complaint No. 2007-238 (October 2008); Morgano v. Essex County Prosecutor’s Office, GRC Complaint no. 2007-156 (February 2008); Nance v. Scotch Plains Township Police Department, GRC Complaint No. 2003-125 (January 2005); Patricia Elaine Cheatham v. Borough of Fanwood Police Department (Union), GRC Complaint No. 2013-262 (March 2014) and Victim’s name or address - N.J.S.A. 47:1A-1.1, et seq. - N.J.S.A. 2A:82-46b as the legal basis for each denial, as is required by N.J.S.A. 47:1A-6. Your request for: "Fatal Accident Following Attempted Motor Vehicle Stop (February 6, 2021) 
Details: Officers attempted to stop Rashad M. Muse, who fled the scene and was fatally struck by civilian vehicles after exiting his vehicle and running onto I-676." 
Custodian's Response: The Camden County Police Department conducted a search of their files and provided a link to the website which contains the requested records. We are providing this link to you pursuant to N.J.S.A. 47:1A-6; Rodriguez v. Kean University, GRC Complaint No. 2013-69 (March 2014). 

[LINK] https://njoag.app.box.com/s/26nguo71rcxbxs1uapgj4jjgp5amxb1c  Your request for: "Incident Involving Weapon Discharge by Officer (April 24, 2023) 
Details: A man allegedly assaulted a police officer during an incident where the officer’s weapon discharged, striking the suspect. Incident occurred in Camden County. 
Camden Public Protest Incident (August 28, 2020) 
Details: An incident during a public protest in Camden where multiple individuals were charged with resisting arrest following a confrontation with law enforcement." 
Custodian's Response:  Your request contains insufficient information and seeks documents that are not specifically “identifiable” for the Camden County Police Department to gather a response.  As such, the request submitted is a wholesale request for information that is not encompassed by the intent of OPRA as has been articulated in N.J.S.A. 47:1A-1, et. seq. and MAG Entertainment, LLC v. Division of Alcoholic Beverage Control, 375 N.J. Super. 534, 546 (App. Div. 2005). 
. to allow the department to conduct a proper search of their records. Please submit a new request, with the pertinent information, such as , a valid Camden Police case number, location (street names, exact addresses), person(s) involved, officer's involved, etc 
Please note, the Camden County Police Department only maintains Camden City. If an incident occurred in a different municipality within Camden County, please contact their Police Departments to obtain records. 
As such, this correspondence and the link provided constitutes completion of your request. 
Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 47:1A-1, et seq. if your request for access to a government record has been denied or unfilled within the seven (7) business days required by law, you have a right to challenge the decision by the County of Camden to deny access. As provided by law, you have the right to either institute a proceeding in the Superior Court of New Jersey or file a complaint with the Government Records Council (GRC) by completing their Denial of Access Complaint Form located at the GRC’s website at www.state.nj.us/grc. (www.state.nj.us/grc) 

You may contact the GRC by toll-free telephone at 866-850-0511, by mail at P.O. Box 819, Trenton, NJ, 08625, by e-mail at grc@dca.state.nj.us. The GRC can also answer other questions about the law. All questions regarding complaints filed in Superior Court should be directed to the Superior Court. (mailto:grc@dca.state.nj.us) 
Should you have any questions, please contact the Custodian of Records at (856) 225-2131. 
Sincerely, 
Cathy Bucceroni  for 
Steffani Lon Steffani Lon 
Custodian of Records 
Camden County 
Office of Archives & Records Management 
Courthouse, 8th Floor 
520 Market Street 
Camden, NJ 08102-1375 
Phone: (856) 225-2131 
E-mail: opra.custodian@camdencounty.com (mailto:opracustodian@camdencounty.com) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY. FOR FURTHER CORRESPONDENCE PLEASE GENERATE A NEW REQUEST THROUGH THE OPEN RECORDS CENTER.

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: FOIA Request :: N016565-120324
communications.communication:
Dear Miriam: 
 
Thank you for your interest in Chicago Public Schools. Your FOIA request has been submitted. Your FOIA Center reference number for tracking purposes is: N016565-120324

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Ftl-mary-beck-email-log-177140%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1tIg9j%3AyQ57Czn_Oegv-FDc699V2O7Fhas2qRCXNCQoZZp_x6U 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. 
You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Your City of Hialeah, FL public records request #24-10731 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
City of Hialeah, FL ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-10731 has been submitted successfully. Thank you for contacting the City of Hialeah. We are in receipt of your public records request. You may use the following two links to access the City’s policy on public records: https://www.hialeahfl.gov/DocumentCenter/View/612/Ordinance-2013-85-PDF https://www.hialeahfl.gov/DocumentCenter/View/182/Ordinance-2018-026-PDF These provisions are consistent with Florida law, and we hope you will find them informative as we fulfill your request. Please be advised that processing your public records request may require extensive use of information technology resources, and/or extensive clerical or supervisory assistance. The City has determined that any request that requires more than fifteen minutes to locate, gather, review, redact, copy or make records available for inspection is an extensive request. These services will be charged at the hourly rate of the least paid employee capable of performing the task according to the City’s policy. You may use the following link to access the City’s ordinance, codified at Section 2-871 in the City of Hialeah Code of Ordinances, which describes the costs of duplication and certification of public documents: https://library.municode.com/fl/hialeah/codes/code_of_ordinances?nodeId=PTIICOOR_CH2AD_ARTVFI_DIV2FECH_S2-871DUCEPUDO . The law requires that we respond to your request within a reasonable time. Reasonable time includes the time necessary to search for records, review and redact the records for exempt or confidential material, as well as copy the records or make them available for inspection. At this time, we will forward your request to the appropriate department(s) in the City to determine whether any records within the department are responsive to your request. Once we have had an opportunity to conduct an internal search, we will prepare a cost estimate for time and resources necessary to provide you with your records, if any, as provided by the City’s policy. Thank you. The due date for your request may be later than usual because the office is closed on: * November 11: Veterans Day * November 28: Thanksgiving * December 24: Christmas Eve * December 25: Christmas Day * December 31: New Year's Eve * January 1: New Year's Day * January 20: Martin Luther King, Jr. Day ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Hialeah, FL.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: P200791-101024
communications.communication:
This email is in further response to your public disclosure records request P200791-101024. The Seattle Police Department has records ready to be released pending payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 SPD strongly encourages online payments. 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: P200791-101024. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-P200791-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. After we receive your payment through the Police Records Request Center Secure Payments, the Public Disclosure Unit will release your records within one to two business days and send you a notice with instructions on how to download the records. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net)

The records responsive to your request are the Records showing retroactive pay amounts paid out to Seattle Police Officer Guild members as a result of the SPOG contract ratified earlier this year. This completes the request. . 
To download your records, please: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center.
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Select this request: P200791-101024. 
  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. 
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 
SPD will take no further action on this request. If you have questions regarding the processing of this request or would like to initiate an administrative appeal regarding the response to your request, please do so within 10 business days. You may also seek judicial review of our response to your request for a period of one year, beginning as of the date of this message, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. 
Please include your name and address, a copy of any redacted files, and a copy of this letter together with a brief statement identifying the basis of the appeal. 
Please submit your appeal via GovQA, the mail, or deliver your appeal to: 
Seattle Police Department 
Attn: Legal Unit Section 
610 Fifth Avenue 
P.O. Box 34986 
Seattle, WA 98124-4986 
 
If you have any questions, you may send a message using the Police Records Request Center or call the Public Disclosure Desk at 206-684-5481. 
 
Sincerely, 
Justin Jackson 
Seattle Police Department 
Legal Unit 
 
SPD receives over 13,000 public records requests annually and is processing between 2,500 to 3,000 open requests at any given time. This may result in a slower than anticipated response to your request. Thank you for your 
patience. 
 
As a reminder you can login at the Police Records Request Center where you can access Police online information, manage your profile, submit record requests, track your request status, receive and send messages, make payments, view frequently asked questions, and download your records. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: N14: Data FOIA Log
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A log of all emails to/from the Justin Gumiran, from November 1, 2024 to November 14, 2024.

1. Please search all CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fsenn-network-chief-email-log-177137%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1tIg5o%3AUuc3vgUvriB0dX5QiL-kX0tPmKGIJ5zuElF1v_ocAIM 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. Student/parent information has been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r) which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA generally prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at is direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored.” (105 ILCS 10/2(d). 
You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools
